title: Stephen Breyer
summary: Stephen Gerald Breyer  (/ˈbraɪ.ər/ BRY-ər; born August 15, 1938) is an American lawyer and jurist who has served as an associate justice of the Supreme Court of the United States since 1994. He was nominated by President Bill Clinton, and replaced retiring justice Harry Blackmun. Breyer is generally associated with the liberal wing of the Court.[1]
